question: Which of the following bariatric procedures is primarily intended to induce weight loss through malabsorption and restriction?
exp: Bariatric procedures are classified as restrictive, malabsorptive, or a combination of restrictive and malabsorptive in the mechanism of weight loss that they induce. Restrictive operations include adjustable gastric band and gastric sleeve, malabsorptive operations include duodenal switch and biliopancreatic diversion, and combined restrictive and malabsorptive procedures include the Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB).

question: All of the following are true about Bariatric surgery except:

opd: Most common cause of death within 30 days of bariatric surgery is peritonitis secondary to anastomotic leak

question: All of the following are true about Fast track surgery except:
exp: Fast track surgery: - Coordinated perioperative appraoch aimed at reducing surgical stress & facililating postoperative recovery - Fast track surgery comprise: - Preoperative informed consent. - Fasting 6 hours for solids & 2 hours for liquids - Atraumatic surgical technique (avoid drains) - Reduction of stress - Elimination of pain by regional anesthesia( thoracic epidural anesthesia) - Optimized fluid & temperature management - Early enteral diet - Prevention of gastrointestinal atony & postoperative nausea & vomiting - Rapid postoperative mobilization
opa: Fasting 6 hours for solids & 2 hours for liquids
opc: Elimination of pain by regional anesthesia
